title: Fun but with minimal replay value.
text: This was the first thing my 12 year old daughter played with on Christmas. The quality is good, and it offers plenty of opportunity to explore your creativity. Designs are somewhat limited to the included foil patterns, and it can get a bit messy as it's difficult to get the adhesive in exactly the right spot, but it's a decent buy, a cool concept, and my daughter was entertained. Questionable as to the replay value though as I haven't seen my daughter play with it again even though she still has some blank dolls and foil left. (Already used templates cannot be used again). Kinda more of a one and done.

title: Great idea, so-so execution
text:
I wanted to love this art set. I bought two, one for my two and four year old.

Pros: I love that everything fits inside the kit so it can be easily stored.

I like the way markers are displayed. It reminds them to put the lids on and keeps us from losing them.

Theoretically would work well for travel. No mess and all pieces are fairly secured onto the kit.

Cons: the kit could be deeper to accommodate more storage. We have additional markers and color wonder coloring books (which you will need since you only get a few sheets with this set) and you can't really fit too much more than what comes with the set inside the case.

The stamp. UGH. Again, I wanted to love it, but even when I tried to get the stamp to work I could barely do it. The kids could never get more than 1/2 of the stamp at best making it impossible to see the animal or use it as a stencil to color in.

Why wouldn't the paper clip onto the kit? Everything else is well suited for travel, but the paper just falls off when they're in the car and then there's a meltdown.

Overall it's fine. Good for travel I suppose, but as a primary art kit, leaves much to be desired.

title: High quality, durable set
text: This product came packaged nicely and in a timely fashion. The plastic is high quality, durable, and I appreciate that it is made of safe materials. The Velcro is strong, but not so much so that my 3 year old can't cut through it. The cutting board is a bit smaller than I expected, but it serves its purpose just fine. All in all great set and all expectations met. I actually just purchased another set because I was so impressed with the quality.

title: Broken pumps.
text: To my surprise and delight this came with three pumps. My daughter was so excited she opened and pumped the balloons right away. It wasn't until quite a few balloons later that she tried one of the other pumps, then the third, and neither of those worked. Now her only good pump is failing too, after only half a day! She is so disappointed, as she purchased this with her own birthday money and can't even use the balloons anymore since she has no pump. What a waste.

title: OK image, working software, but dirty CCD and problematic LED battery.
text:
Surprisingly, the software "TJViewer" works well in my three Win10 computers, with images clearly shown on monitor. Image quality looks ok for me. Took it to kids party, they enjoyed it very well.
Build quality generally fine for the scope, but the CCD module is cheaply made.
One complain is the CCD surface not clean. Several black dots and a short hair/fiber can be seem on CCD image. I dissemble the CCD module and blow the CCD with a compress air dust blower, now much better, but still two or three black dots presented.
Another complain is the LED battery seems not normal. Every time charging, after several seconds, the charging red light turns off automatically. The LED light does work, but lasts only about 10 mins.

Want to return it, but the one month return window closed.

title: Works perfectly with the DGT board
text:
Great chess computer with horrible instructions. Customer service is non existent.
Works great with DGT board. Pieces are properly read, interfaces perfectly with usb speaker. Digital display is poor. fortunately, the interfaced $10 speaker provides for a clear audible instruction for computer moves. Extremely happy despite poor customer service and poor instruction manual. I play against the default settings (which is challenging enough) because I haven't figured out yet how to change settings.

title: Great product lousy customer service
text: Finally was able to hookup my wooden digital board with the DGT Pi. The board, digital chess pieces, and PI worked perfectly. However, the digital read on the PI was not easy to read. A $10 speaker that goes easily into the PI has solved the problem. DGT instructions for the PI are terrible. Customer service is non existent. The US office never answers any emails or phone calls. I'm playing at the default settings, which is very challenging because I haven't yet figured out how to change settings. But I don't mind playing a tough opponent.

title: Not Clear that it didn't come with Cable to Charge
text: My son patiently waited to get this for Christmas and once he opened it to try to use it, all the directions say to charge the battery first...HOWEVER, there is not a cable in order to charge the battery.  This was $400+ and we are not able to use the "rechargeable battery" that is provided with the system, and yet this is supposed to be a "Core" starting set.  The fight that ensued in my house because of the lack of a key component was so not worth the expense.  Just wish it was clear that this was an additional component that would be needed to be purchased separately, so it would have been purchased at the same time, and provided with the gift, so it could have been used to its fullest potential.

title: Maybe just a little too cheap...pieces too small and light.
text: This chess set is okay, but the big negative is that the pieces are relatively small, and super light plastic, making it really hard to not knock the pieces over and off the board when you are trying to make the moves.  Due to this we have hardly made it through a match, since if you put the pieces in the wrong place, you have taken the computer right out of the game in its ability to generate moves that make sense in relation to the game pieces.  Another thing that throws off the board computer is that the white/black pieces must be set up as they are on the picture in the manual, BUT it in no way ever tells you this.  My husband discovered this fact, when the computer was having him Castle his Queen (which would have been the King if it was set up right - but there was no way to know, since it wasn't in the instructions).  Otherwise it is what it claims to be, and my 6 yr old learned quickly how to follow the lights for the suggested moves of pieces on the labeled grid board.

title: 72 Seconds of Light!!????
text:
This is meant as a night light for kids and doesn't even stay on for 2 minutes. So not worth it!!!!!!

I got this for my son as a stocking stuffer, because he had been asking for one for a while, and no where on the package did it say how long it stayed lit for, and I remembered the commercials for the regular Dream Lites, where it was something like 20 minutes, and assumed it would be the same, since there was nothing on the package. :(

The information on how long it stays lit is only on the enclosed pamphlet, after you have opened the product.

title: A poorly thought out and executed product.
text:
This was purchased by my parents as a gift for their grandson who is a huge Angry Birds fan and loves Angry Birds Star Wars II. Unfortunately, this toy was not the quality product we hoped it would be.

First, it is very important that you carefully check the device list on the official website. These toys DO NOT WORK on the vast majority of tablets and phones. Unfortunately, they did not work on my son's tablet, an Acer Icona. We checked the product list and it listed the Samsung Galaxy 3, which I happen to have, so I downloaded the game to my phone so my son could play with his new toy.

Second, the toys are extremely difficult to teleport into the game. It takes several minutes of manipulating the direction you are holding the lens, the lighting in the room to get the toys to teleport into the game. It was impossible for my 5 year old to do it on his own, so we had to spend several minutes teleporting each character into the game.

The worst part is once you close the game, the characters you teleported in are deleted from the game, so if you want to use them again, you have to go through the process in the second paragraph all over again.

This additional toy added nothing but frustration to an otherwise fun game.

title: Awesome fun on a hot summer day
text:
Played this at a summer camp but we altered it and the hat remained on the person and you took turns trying to pull out the right spoke to get the person wet. The guy in the hat will get wet but the fun is in trying to be the "assassin" who is the one to pull the right spoke. It's very fun this way. I have been the guy in the hat and the guy pulling the spoke. As the hat wearer, you breathe a sigh of relief each time a spoke is pulled and you don't get wet, then tense up when the next guy steps forward to take his turn. Eventually, you will get wet.
As the "assassin", you hope you pull the correct spoke. It's awesome when it happens when you are the first one up, pull the right spoke and get the "victim" wet.

Best to have a bucket and a funnel for quick fill ups

Pros
Awesome fun
Lots of laughs
Great fun on a hot day
Different kind of game
Kids get very into this game

Cons
If you have a large head, this will not fit and has to be held on for the game.
If you have over zealous players, they can pull so hard on the spokes as they turn it, it can nearly rip your head off
If kids do not like getting wet, don't even try this

title: Awesome game that creates a lot of laughs!
text:
I got this for a Chanukah present for friends. After we had a tragedy in my family during Chanukah, it was halted in its tracks and all parties stopped. Last night we decided to get together with friends and have latkes even though Chanukah was long past.

I gave them this game as a present and it's really fun!

We had to alter the rules to say the person with the majority wins because if you played until one person got 4 cards, it might take a while.

It was a great way to tease people but also know what others think of you. Who is most likely to get stopped for driving slow? Who has a moral compass broken beyond repair? Who will change the world? Who gets in trouble at work the most? My best friend was won "who was the biggest bully in school?", "who has the longest criminal record?" (No one at the table had anything other than parking or speeding tickets and we all knew it so it was just fun to guess) and "who would stay the most calm in a national emergency?".
We are game players and all agreed this was a super fun game.

I might just have to get one for myself lol

title: Save your money
text:
This was pretty disappointing. You cannot do anything without buying ingredients separately. If you're set on getting it, I'd recommend at least buying sodium alginate and calcium lactate. I believe everything else can be purchased at a regular grocery store.

My 9 year old found a few experiments she was interested in, and she does like the tools. Honestly though, just buy a few test tubes/candy molds/a whisk/pipette and find experiments online. The muffin tins are a pain, just use a regular muffin pan.

I wouldn't buy this again or give it as a gift unless you also buy the ingredients needed for multiple experiments. Bare minimum, I'd include: sodium alginate, calcium lactate, dry yeast, yogurt starter, and several fruit juices/cordials. Otherwise you're giving a gift that will inevitably lead to a disappointed child and frustrated parent.

title: Fun, but really loud and cannot turn it off
text:
[[VIDEOID:3ff1a927a97195cb8ef0b1bdd1b16c0d]] My 6 month old likes it enough. The buttons are easy to push, so he has no issues engaging with it. The problem is that it's so much louder than other noisy toys and there's no volume control options. It's much louder than every other toy we have When they have the volume turned all the way up/at the highest level.

There is a switch on the bottom to turn it off/on. Unfortunately, this switch does absolutely nothing (as you can see in the posted video). This is very frustrating when I'm trying to clean up and it starts blasting music and sounds. It has woken him up on multiple occasions. We took the batteries out for a while, but then it loses its appeal and he never plays with it.

Maybe we just got a dud. There is an on/off switch, so we may have just received one that's defective. If it worked, I would probably rate it 3 stars. Baby enjoys it, but due to the high volume and no option to turn it down, I can't justify a higher rating. There are thousands of options for baby toys and I'd much rather have one that can't be heard through the entire house.

title: Don't waste your money
text:
This is just awful. There's a list in the instruction pamphlet showing what should be there and several pieces that should've been included weren't. The perfume spray bottles don't produce a mist, it's literally like a squirt gun. I hoped it we were just unlucky with the first spray bottle, so we tried the other one and it was just as bad. What comes out of the perfume squirt guns is nothing more than a sticky mess with barely any scent. My 9 year old was thrilled to receive this as a gift for Christmas and had no problem independently reading, understanding, and following the instructions. I figured she missed something after the initial results were so bad, so we made another batch of perfume together. I was wrong.

This is a great concept, but very poor execution. When she was putting her Christmas gifts away, she asked if she could just throw it away. Very disappointing

title: Sounds awful
text: [[VIDEOID:6c81671ef35e0e0aafb707b8d54a0bf4]] My mom bought this for my little one recently. The doll itself is cute and soft, but that's the only good thing about it. Upon first years we discovered that the sound is completely off. Look at the video I uploaded to see what I mean. We tried changing the batteries twice, but that's not the problem. She bought it while I was still pregnant so at this point it's too late to return. For the price this definitely is not worth it there's so many other cute peekaboo stuffed animals that actually do work. Maybe I just got a lemon but I wouldn't waste my money on it if I were you. The bandanna doesn't even cover his eyes when he lifts it up. Really cute concept but it just didn't pan out.

title: Fun family project that led to great Christmas decor
text: I bought this puzzle through iseeme.com. Our daughters Elf on the Shelf left it for her one day last week. She was thrilled, but it was somewhat daunting for her. She's 7, and this was her first puzzle over 50 pieces. We put it together as a family over the course of 3 evenings (1-2hours each night). I was surprised at how much she enjoyed it and stayed involved from beginning to end. I'm going to frame it and it will become a part of our Christmas decor. Definitely a great puzzle- it looks great, and the way it's sectioned made it easier to put together.

title: Made learning fun again and taught my daughter to recognize every letter in the alphabet!
text:
I honestly cannot say enough how much I love this game. Best $6 or $7 I've spent in a long time. It was a last minute "why not" purchase as a Christmas present for my 4 year old daughter. She wasn't exactly thrilled when she opened it. It doesn't have all the bells and whistles kids nowadays are accustomed to. After one game, this became our new family favorite. I've been struggling to help her learn the letters of the alphabet before she starts preschool in the fall. I've tried a lot of ways (mainly from Pinterest which typically is a lifesaver) but she would get bored with it after 10-15 minutes. I think because she sees this as a game (which it is) instead of something she "has" to do, she loves it and a month later we still play a few times a day. At its core it's your basic bingo game. Everything is paper. The large letter board seems like regular weight paper, and the bingo cards, letters, and red dots are a heavier weight card stock. Our letter board has a few minor rips in it and has had water spilled on it at least once, but it still serves its purpose. If you are able to, I would recommend laminating everything (especially if using it in a classroom setting).

My daughter is really catching on and can now independently recognize every letter of the alphabet! In the beginning when she only recognized about half of the letters, we had her start at A and point to each letter while saying/singing her ABCs until she got to the letter on the card. I thought she would be over it by the second game, but surprisingly she loved it! I'm so glad I bought this game, it has truly increased her confidence and has her eager to learn again! Would buy this again in a heartbeat.

title: Perfectly combines a young child's love for Disney Princesses with water play
text:
My husband bought this for our 4 year old daughters Rapunzel theme birthday party in mid August 2016. He purchased it at Walmart and I have no idea how much he spent so I cannot comment on the price comparison, but at the time of writing this review it is $14 on Amazon and I think that's a fair price. My daughter was so excited about this doll, and I must agree that the idea of it is awesome. She was so eager to "paint" Rapunzels dress. The white part of her dress will change when you rub the "paint brush" over it. You fill the brush with water and there's a small sponge type thing at the top of it that you use to paint the dress. I was initially concerned that this was going to end in a big mess, but I'm happy to say I was wrong. It's almost 100% mess free. When there's water and children you've got to expect a little clean up afterward, but honestly it's not even enough to warrant wiping up with a paper towel... It's a fairly simple concept and our daughter is able to do everything (including filling the brush and securing the stopper so it doesn't leak) which is a win for both of us. She's at that age where independence is big, and she feels so proud and confident when she can independently play with something that Mom or Dad had to help her with in the past.
In the 4+ months she has had this doll I'd guess it's been "painted" 20-30 times and it still returns to white after it has dried. I saw a review where the dress stayed "painted" after 3 uses, and I'm guessing that they got a bad/defected one. Maybe it got soaking wet and that caused it. Idk, I can only tell you what our experience has been. Ours has never been fully saturated with water. There are a few small scratches on the white part where you can see the colors, but I'd expect that. I don't know of any toy that a 4 year old plays with often that doesn't have a few scratches and other minor damage to it. Overall it has held up and works better than I initially expected. Any toy that combines dolls and water play will likely be a hit (at least with the kids)! I'd buy it again in a heartbeat. She likes it so much that Santa recently brought her the Cinderella one and we are just as happy with that one as well.

title: Has every function kids love: water, bubbles, and moving parts. My daughters favorite Barbie.
text: My almost 4 year old is just starting to take an interest in Barbies. I'm so mad I didn't keep all of mine from my childhood, I could be saving a bundle!  She really doesn't care what Barbie she gets, she just loves to use her imagination and play with dolls. We had a small birthday party for her at my Grandparents house since they cannot travel to come to her main birthday party.  We bought her a Power Wheels for her birthday, so I didn't want to spend a lot but needed something to give her at her "other" party. I am so glad I went with this!  Her and her 2 cousins (7 year old girl and 3 year old boy) had so much fun playing with this set.  When I was taking it out of the box and talking to my daughter about the dog shaking the water off my Mom kept saying there's no way that dog is going to move. We were all pleasantly surprised when I pushed down on the dog colar. I LOVE that there are no batteries, no winding it up, just push down and watch the dogs tail spin in circles and head go back and forth. I read several reviews that love the dog, but were dissappointed in the barbie.  I knew going in that her arms don't move from their position, so I wasn't thrown off by that feature, and I honestly don't think it's a big deal AT ALL. The kids didn't seem to mind one bit. The thing is, there are a million different barbies, that do a million different things. This Barbie is the designated dog washer in Barbie Land, lol. Her arms don't need to move for her to serve her purpose... Of course anything with water is going to hold a childs attention just a little bit longer than usual. The three kids sat on the bathroom floor for over an hour taking turns washing the dog!  Their favorite feature is the soap bottle. I will say that is the only thing that may become annoying to a parent over time. It's appropriately sized for the playset, but we found ourselves refilling that bottle about every 4-5 minutes while they played with it. If you have an older child who could fill it themselves with water and a drop or two of soap, then you have nothing to worry about. The soap bottle is actually a really ingenius feature. I filled it with water and added about a quarter pump of hand soap, put the cap back on and shook it up before giving it back to the kids. If you hold it upside down (cap side down) water comes out the holes, but if you hold it right side up (or sideways) and squeeze you'll only have bubbles coming out so you can "wash" the dog. This is hands down her favorite Barbie in her collection! Such a simple concept, yet it's provided hours of fun every day for the past week.

title: Just like I remember it!
text: Who doesn't remember this from their childhood? It's exactly as I remember it and my three-year-old daughter loves it.  I love that it will grow with her and continue to be a challenge for her because let's face it when a kid gets bored with the toy they move on. This is a toy that will get many years of use and is built to last.  I love that the whole family gets involved in playtime when we play with this. You won't regret buying it. The price is extremely reasonable for the amount of memories you will make.

title: Perfect doll to teach independence!
text: I absolutely love this doll almost as much as my 3 year old daughter. Okay so she pretty much likes any doll, but I love the idea of this doll. My daughter is at an age where she strives for independence in every aspect of her life. The Dressy Kids doll is helping her learn dressing skills everyday through play. I'm so glad I found this doll and my daughter is glad she found a new friend!

title: Wow
text: This guy is fantastic! As an avid figure collector i know good quality from lousy one, but this figure surpassed all my expectations. He's big, sturdy and made with utmost attention to details even his box is wonderful! He looks very nice and so cool and posing him is easy, he's quite flexible but I wouldn't be too rough with any action figure type figure. For people who don't like his base and want another one there are a few options first you can use a bamboo coaster which I'm using for my play arts kai ff13 figures or you can buy an unfinished wooden base from michaels and paint it yourself or you can buy a fully finished base from E2046 they have a wide selection of nice bases but their shipping is kind of high, to secure him on his base try using double sided sticky squares which are used to mount wall posters, works very well and don't harm the paint and easy to cut to size. Hope this help! I highly recommend this figure it's amazing!

title: Great figure! I love it.
text: I received him today, he looks so cool. So much attention to details specially in his face, his brand looks nice, his cloth are soft and flexible and his joints are strong and he's very flexible. This a collector figure and not a kids toy so bear in mind that fact before buying they may be sturdy and well made but they still can't endure kids rough play, they are specifically made for adult collectors and display in dynamic poses. Personally i like this figure, he definitely got lots of fine details and a great deal of craftsmanship, i like the character from the game i decided to buy the figure and this is the first play arts figure i own and I'm certainly not disappointed with the quality. I'm a figure collector but all my figures are complete non action figures, snow is the first action figure i own and he well deserves a spot on a display shelf next to any other cool figure. Buy it I certainly recommend it.

title: A very good RC car
text: Definitely well made and has tons of good details like the shiny tires and front mirrors, the matte finish is nice too makes it look elegant. It has three lights options, and it goes so fast, the remote is easy to handle and the battery was included which was a very good surprise to me. Came fast in the mail and that was another good surprise. I bought a velocity toy rc car before this one and it doesn't compare in quality, this one definitely wins. Overall it was a good purchase and i will be buying more maisto rc cars in the future.
